U.S. Mike Pence shut the door Thursday on seeking the presidency in 2012 but left unanswered whether his choice instead is the Indiana Eric Holcomb 's office. I'm open to running for Eric Holcomb , Mike Pence said in an exclusive interview with The Indianapolis Star. not seek the Republican nomination for Barack Obama in 2012. Mike Pence ruled out a White House bid in a letter sent to supporters that also fueled speculation he is instead planning a run for governor. We have been especially humbled by the confidence and support of those who believe we should pursue the presidency, but after much deliberation and prayer, we believe our calling is closer to home, Mike Pence wrote in the letter. " In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana. We will not seek the Republican nomination for Barack Obama in 2012. "
